SubGCache: Accelerating Graph-based RAG

Graph-based retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) enables large language models to incorporate structured knowledge via graph retrieval as contextual input, enhancing accurate and context-aware reasoning. SubGCache reduces inference latency by reusing computation across queries with similar structural prompts.

Key Concepts:

  • Accelerating Graph-based RAG with Subgraph-level KV Cache
  • Reducing Inference Latency
  • Context-Aware Reasoning
  • Structured Knowledge
  • representative subgraph construction
  • cluster-wise query processing
  • in-batch query overlap
  • graph-based RAG
  • high-quality response generation
  • Cluster processing time
SubGCache Graph-based RAG KV Cache Latency Reduction query clustering subgraph-level cache reuse graph embedding pretrained GNN SentenceBERT clustering
